Reviews.Title: Very loud and reliable alert
Reviews.Author: Dirk Hain "horstkotte"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to get an early alert in case one of my under the sink water filters starts leaking or one of the pipes breaks.  So far I have not had an alarm except for one time when in the middle of the night it went off and woke me up sleeping with closed doors in the floor above (yes, this leak alert is LOUD).  A slug that I had accidentally carried into the house with the trash bin cause the alert to go off probably because it touched both connectors.Anyway, I thought this was a good sign that the leak alert would alert me if I ever have a leak.

Reviews.Title: Saved the basement a few times already!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Zrinsky
Reviews.Content: We were having problems with sewage backing up into our basement from the floor drain.  I purchased one of these and placed the probe in the drain to give us an early warning of water rising up.  Works perfectly and is really loud.  The alarm has two volume settings and an on/off switch.  It gave us enough warning to call the city and have them fix the sewer before the water backed up!  I got a second one to put in our sump pump crock to warn us if that is filling up too.

Reviews.Title: False alarms
Reviews.Author: Derek_P
Reviews.Content: Without getting into a scientific testing process, it is firing false alarms.  I have it hanging in my sump pit well above the water line and it should not be getting splashed.  About every 2 months, it goes off at 2-3am.  I then rush down to my basement freaking out to the ear piercing sound to shut it off after finding no water (which is good for me, but bad for a device solely invented to detect water).  This thing isn't worth the false alarms.  It's probably just too sensitive and the humidity causes a false contact.  I'd love to see a unit that doesn't go off until 3 - 5 seconds of full submersion, but that would cost more.  I went cheap and got cheap.Positive note, this thing is very, very loud.  I can hear it through several solid wood doors closed through the floor (it's in the basement and I'm on the first floor).

Reviews.Title: Very loud and discreet (visually)
Reviews.Author: J. Cummings
Reviews.Content: Got this to alert me if my washer ever leaks.  It seems to do the job (tested it several times)  Luckily have not had a flood as of yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Alarm - bad instruction booklet
Reviews.Author: Dugout
Reviews.Content: Unit is sensitive and LOUD. Perfect for my basement.Much better than the Rialco 94010 which is cheaper construction and hard to hear.Only reason I didn't give it 5 was that the manual is incomplete & I had to figure it out. It actually does not tell you how to use the alarm, and even fails to mention 2 of the controls ( even it the diagram )

Reviews.Title: LOUD
Reviews.Author: Mark Nadig "<><"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these and one of the Glentronics, Inc. BWD-HWA and I found the Swann to be louder and a better design overall (sensor can be placed short distance away from alarm). Most of all, the Swann is very LOUD which is great for my basement application. The Swann also is supposed to have a low batter alert, which I have not tested.I only wish it worked on a 9v instead of 2 AAA.I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Poor
Reviews.Author: Robert J Taggart
Reviews.Content: The unit is below my expectation. The power light doesn't work. The test button doesn't work and the cord to the sensor is too short so the unit has to be placed close to floor level. It's not convenient. The unit did work when sensor we placed in water so I am using it until I find a better unit

Reviews.Title: Sensor works well
Reviews.Author: Rob Goody
Reviews.Content: This leak alarm is just what I was looking for.  Wanting to check it out, I touched the leads to a puddle on the floor.  The alarm instantly went off, it was very loud.  I removed the sensor and reset the alarm.  I'm confident in the alarms ability to notify us in the event of a leak.  As far as the person who had difficulty with it mounted by their sump pit and rated it low - the sensor detects conductivity between the two probes, such as the conductivity of water.  The moisture generated at the sump pit was enough to trigger the alarm; they would be well suited to choose a different mounting location.

Reviews.Title: A must for safety
Reviews.Author: Donna . "Donna Blankenhorn"
Reviews.Content: Our water heater is in the house so is important as we have had 2 go out with water going into hall and living room and alerted us the last time after using this. Also for bathrooms it is important. This could save you money and headache of water damage.

Reviews.Title: It worked
Reviews.Author: Jason W Morrison
Reviews.Content: It didn't take a lot of water to set this unit off.  It wasn't terribly loud, but it was loud enough that I could hear something odd and went to investigate.  I had forgotten about the alarm until I realized where the sound was coming from.  I had a humidifier malfunction and dump water into the basement.

Reviews.Title: Simple and effective
Reviews.Author: S. Farrar
Reviews.Content: For the price this device is very cheap insurance. It was easy to set up and works well when tested. As long as you can put it where you'll hear the alarm it should be very effective. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed and VERY loud
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This is a very very good product.  Definitely the best solution to my problem for the price.  It is very loud.  I have it in my basement and I do not thinkI will have any trouble hearing it on the second floor.  Much better then the water watchdog brand one that is found at home depot/lowes.  This one is much louder and it is nice that it can stick to stuff.  Highly recommend it.  Might buy another just in case they stop making it.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says, plenty loud and effective
Reviews.Author: MSB
Reviews.Content: This product just works and oh my is it loud on the HI setting. You'll still hear it on low for the loudness but to be sure I leave it on high and each time think maybe I should turn it down. My sump pump moves very slightly over time when it rains heavy for a couple days and the float gets a little stuck causing the water to rise. As soon as it hits the sensors on this leak alarm it lets me know immediately. I re-position the pump, drop the alarm sensor back in the hole and done.

Reviews.Title: A REALLY loud water alert alarm
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive little device that can save you $ if you pop a leak in the house (dishwasher, clothes dryer, water heater, etc) It has an utterly perching sound, you cannot ignore it (which is good) when it detects a leak. Operates with batteries, works well. Just a great price

Reviews.Title: packs a loud punch
Reviews.Author: cb
Reviews.Content: It put this in my basement mechanical room by the main floor drain in case of a sewer back up. I was mopping the floor & the mop accidentally touched one of the sensors. It was so loud I nearly jumped outta my skin. Seems to work like a charm. Just wish the cord was a little longer.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Loud Enough
Reviews.Author: Monk4Hire
Reviews.Content: This has a piercing sound that can be easily heard above the washer that it is next to.  The cord between the sensor and the alarm/battery portion retains the twisted shape after unpacking.  This makes it difficult to point the sensor so that it always touches the floor if you want it to alarm at the slightest hint of water.

Reviews.Title: Good alarm
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: The alarm is mediocre. It mounts with double sided tape, wish it mounted with screws... Double sided tape mixed with water is not a good combo. The alarm is LOUD when it goes off but I have to deal with the noise while I dismantle it and remove the battery as this is the only way to reset the alarm.

Reviews.Title: Super loud, but limited in placement
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: The alarm on this unit is super loud.  However, the wire on this is rigid and it made it difficult to make sure the contacts were in the right place to recognize water.  If the wire had been a bit more pliable and a bit longer I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Works great. Added additional wire length.
Reviews.Author: Bennett Giesler
Reviews.Content: I bought this and actually ended up extending the wires so I could use it in my sump pump well. I mounted it up high and the wall and added 5' of wire between it and the sensor. Works great for what I need. It's also extremely LOUD. you will hear this thing go off no doubt. Out of the box it's about 1 foot of wire between it and the sensor.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Von J. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these units.  One to put behind a fridge where I had had a leak problem. The other to put in the laundry room.  Based on other reviews I though these would work well for me.  I liked the fact that the probe was at the end of a length of a wire  so the alarm unit could be separated the water source.  When the units arrived, I placed the batteries in the units and found that neither of them worked. I double checked the batteries to make certain I had the correct polarity and checked the voltage.  They were at full voltage.  The led didn't light and I was unable activate the alarm.  I had to return the units.

Reviews.Title: Would prefer some kind of screw on mounting bracket
Reviews.Author: jasonkhonlaw
Reviews.Content: The alarm is very loud and I do feel safer after installing them in each bathroom.I've had issues with the double sided sticky backing.  After applying them behind my toilets to clean walls, the units fall off after about a week.  I've had to rehang them several times, which is pretty annoying.  The unit I attached to the metal side of the furnace next to the water heater stuck very well however, but not to painted drywall.I would prefer some kind of optional screw on mounting bracket.  The sticky tape is unreliable.  If the unit isn't positioned properly, it will be ineffective, so having it mounted correctly and having it stay in that configured location is a must.

Reviews.Title: Should be able to hear this alarm from anywhere in the house.
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Rampey
Reviews.Content: We sometimes get water in our basement when the outside drain gets stopped up with leaves or other things and this should help by letting us know when this happens.  It seems to take a very small amount of water to set the alarm off and that is a good thing and it is sure loud enough for us to hear from anywhere in the house.  So no more surprises of very wet floors.  Since we are not in the basement every day, this will be a great help to us.

Reviews.Title: Plug Your Ears If This Thing Goes Off
Reviews.Author: Jay Z "RootfortheCubbies"
Reviews.Content: Gave this sucker a test, worked like a charm, I would say it was just as loud, if not louder, than a smoke detector.  I just hope I don't have to hear the thing go off out side of a shot glass of water spill test.

Reviews.Title: Super Loud
Reviews.Author: CWatson
Reviews.Content: I needed to get a water alarm that was loud enough to be used in the basement and heard on the second floor----and it is!

Reviews.Title: LOUD
Reviews.Author: Ski "skidawg01"
Reviews.Content: Does what it's supposed to at a great price...be forewarned - IT'S LOUD!!! I installed this in a small basement bathroom and figured I'd test it - WOW - by far the loudest water alarm I have used (probably shouldn't have tested it in a confined space, but I figured it'd be a tolerable beep like the others I've tried...I was wrong).  For my situation it's perfect...needed one of these that could be heard upstairs from it

Reviews.Title: Very reliable!
Reviews.Author: Colonel2112
Reviews.Content: This Swan leak alarm was a great purchase! Easy to set up, has 2 different sound levels for the alarm! Also has a battery check button to let you know the battery is working without having to wet the probes! Comes with square double stick sided foam to place on the back of the receiver, then you stick it on the wall! Holds very firmly! Has a 6 inch cord for the probes, stick it on the wall and tape down the cord so the probes barely sit above the floor so when the water does back up this alarm will let you know before you end up with a full blown flood! Excellent product! Received quickly, another great buy with Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use and Effective
Reviews.Author: LostinCleveland
Reviews.Content: It was easy to install and is loud enough to hear through out the house, I have it installed with the prongs just inside the top of our drainage sink to prevent it from flooding without us knowing when the washer accidentally stops it up. I accidentally dropped a wet towel on it one morning and even that amount of moisture set it off but that's been the only false alarm.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Aquae Atrae
Reviews.Content: Installed several of these in electrical utility rooms with plumbing at work and home. The first one already saved our butt once within its first week.

Reviews.Title: Nice Alarm
Reviews.Author: Nkmic
Reviews.Content: This alarm is very nice, but the connection to the sensor is too short. To use it e.g. behind a washing machine the cable should at least be 4 feet long. I had to solder a longer cable in.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: Sean McGovern
Reviews.Content: Sensor works great, alarm very loud. Not worried about undetected water problems anymore, money extremely well spent. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Super short cable
Reviews.Author: B. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: The white cable lead going to the water sensors is super short.  But like other reviewers have said, the alarm is very loud.  I can hear it one floor up, but not two.  I put a baby monitor in the basement with the receiver upstairs to transmit any warning sounds for me.

Reviews.Title: Best yet... except...
Reviews.Author: Bill Raley "Vista Bill"
Reviews.Content: This is the best water alarm I have yet used... but the only drawback is the sensor. it will not set on the 'floor' without fabricating something to keep the sensors directly on the floor. I have it taped in a vertical position so that the sensors will react as soon as wather is evident. Otherwise... I love it! Loud? I am hard of hearing, nearly deaf in one ear and I can hear the alarm while asleep in another room. That's what I wanted and this alarm does exactly that. I am using the alarm adjacent to my air conditioner condensate pan in my condominium. The hvac unit is in the ceiling of a walk in closet. The drain pipe has clogged up numerous times ovver the past 20+ years and when the overflow is not detected quickly, a big water mess is created. I purchased a "Leak Frog" alarm several years ago and it performs very well. It emits a beeping sound. But, being behind the return register, I have a difficult time hearing it unless I am very close to the unit. This Swann alarm is extremely loud! A siren type of sound is emitted. It's inexpensive, well made, and very easy to install. I highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: EXACTLY as discribed
Reviews.Author: C. Gillespie
Reviews.Content: This are crazy loud... but that is what you want if you have a flood or sump pump failure.I would recommend this many

Reviews.Title: So good and so loud!
Reviews.Author: Iris Bayin
Reviews.Content: Works like a charm and let me just say, this is so so so very loud, it will make you half deaf if you stand next to it for more than a few seconds when the setting is on loud.It is very good for basements and places where you ACTUALLY need it to be extra loud!Overall amazing product!

Reviews.Title: does the job!
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Fichelson "Movie Lover"
Reviews.Content: Have a basement bathroom prone to back up and by the time I find out it is usually a $500+ job for a plumbing co. Now I can hear this alarm one floor up and stop the problem before it gets costly. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Idea, very good product !!
Reviews.Author: Osama Elkishawi
Reviews.Content: 2 months ago I had my sewer back flowing in my basement, would've I had this device then it would've saved my wife and I a lot of time cleaning every thing after it was unclogged. This device can give you an early alert if this had to happen again thus saving a lot of time and energy. I like the volume setting on it, you can use very loud if it was in the basement, or loud like the ones we have in the main floor. I have bought 3 of them and they gave me peace of mind in catching any kind of leak that I might have.

Reviews.Title: Just works
Reviews.Author: A. Travis "High Flyer"
Reviews.Content: I have one of these in the pan under our water heater to warn me if the heater starts leaking.  It just works, and works well.

Reviews.Title: Works great... it protects well against any water on the floors..
Reviews.Author: Petru Groza
Reviews.Content: It works very well and I am very pleased with it. I had our cleaning lady clean in the laundry room but forgot to let her know I installed the water leak alarm.. Nobody was home and she calls me all scared that an alarm started as she was mopping the floor. So it works! :)

Reviews.Title: Best water alarm out there
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought the most popular one in the list a few years ago.  I tested it when I installed a new sump pump a couple weeks ago & it worked.  Then when the rod on the new sump pump stuck the following week & my basement flooded, the most popular alarm did nothing to notify us.  Don't waste your money on it.This alarm is extremely loud - loud as in if it is going off in your basement it would wake you up on the 2nd floor.  And it doesn't sound like other devices in your home - it is a siren sound so it is easy to identify.  There is a loud & louder setting, and a button to push to test the battery.  I hope to never hear this alarm go off, but feel safer that it is there.

Reviews.Title: Good alarm for the right conditions
Reviews.Author: PlicketyCat
Reviews.Content: We live in an off-grid home with minimal indoor plumbing, and purchased this alarm to warn us when the buckets under our sink drains are getting full and need to be emptied. We attached the alarm to the inside of the cabinet and draped the sensor over the rim of the bucket. The multi-use alarm works wonderfully and it is VERY loud.Three features keep me from giving this unit 5 stars: 1) The sensor lead cable is very short which makes placing it a bit awkward; 2) there isn't a snooze/reset on the alarm, you must turn it ON/OFF manually with a side switch each time it goes off; 3) the ON/OFF switch is small and lard to locate in dim lighting (like a basement or under a cabinet) and there is no LED to indicate when it's ON.  The last two issues are particularly troublesome if you're using it in a situation of frequent wetting vs. rare.I would recommend this unit for warning about occasional basement or appliance leaks when the unit can be placed close to the area of concern in a well-lit location that is easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: Swann SW351-WLA Water Leak Alarm
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product.  We have on demand hot water heaters, one of them flooded about a 1200 sq. ft. area in the middle of the night before we knew what was going on.  This is the second type of water alarm we have tried because my washer over flowed, we used this water alarm and it is the BEST!  I promise you will wake up out of a sound sleep when this goes off.  We have placed it on all water heaters and the washing machine.  I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't want their house flooded and wants to take precautions.  We have tried several types yet this one does what the manufacture says it will do.  We  would give more than 5 stars if we could.

Reviews.Title: Very loud!
Reviews.Author: Philip Trubey
Reviews.Content: Very loud, works like a charm. We use it when filling up a large can of water with DI water for the aquarium to tell us to stop filling.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: jperrin56
Reviews.Content: Worked as advertised, docs are very limited, but for what it does it does not need much.Had a false alarm the other day because the sensor was touching the concrete floor of my basement and concrete had absorbed some humidity. Otherwise works fine.

Reviews.Title: works good
Reviews.Author: Dave.
Reviews.Content: Use it for a sump pump alarm in my crawl space.  I tested it and it is very loud.  So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Good, helpful, I wish the cord was a little longer
Reviews.Author: DesertIce "DesertIce"
Reviews.Content: good product at good price. loud enough that i installed it in the basement and we could hear it from the second floor... I would have given it 5 stars had the sensor cord been a little longer...

Reviews.Title: Swamm Water Leak Alarm
Reviews.Author: DIYer Dave
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and use. It takes about 30 seconds for alarm to sound when water is detected and it is very loud. It will wake the dead.

Reviews.Title: Great So far
Reviews.Author: J.D.
Reviews.Content: So I have a sump pump. Sump pumps suck, but they also sometimes don't. When they don't you need one of these to tell you. It worked in a glass of water. It worked once when the pump didn't. I'm pretty happy so far.

Reviews.Title: 2nd time around works fine.......
Reviews.Author: Phil J "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Had to return 1st one I received since it was dead on delivery.  Got a replacement 2 days  after reporting broken one.  Love the Amazon no hassle return policy.  New one works fine.  As others have reported alarm is quite loud. Tested it in basement next to sump pump and could hear alarm in 2nd floor bedroom. Cord that the sensors are attached to is only 10" long so for what I want it for hanging over sump pump hole water would almost be overflowing before alarm would go off indicating that the pump wasn't working. Overall if you get a working one a good product.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this, I wasn't sure what to expect, but this thing is way louder than I thought it would be. While I was expecting the cord to be a bit longer, it works out perfectly. I attached this to the lid of our sump pump and let the cord dangle into the pit. We had an older pump that wasn't working properly and this alerted us every time. I've since replaced the pump, but this worked great every time.

Reviews.Title: no more leaks
Reviews.Author: David Aquiles Y. Matus "David Aquiles y Matus"
Reviews.Content: I use it when I fill the pitcher of water at home to be purificaded and I have not more spils or leaks

Reviews.Title: Good Product at Good Price
Reviews.Author: Hootenanny
Reviews.Content: This is a well working product offered at a very reasonable price.  I would recommend it to those who are wanting to be cautious about water heater leaks.

Reviews.Title: very cheep will not last
Reviews.Author: Skip
Reviews.Content: the unit is the cheapest piece of junk you will ever see. it will not last, if you need this to work in an emergencey  for get it

ProductInfo.Features:
Protects Home Or Property From Water Damage
Monitors Areas With Potential For Water Leaks
Alarm Is Triggered When Water Leak Or Flooding Is Detected
Unique Slim, Weather-Resistant Design
Multidirectional Sensor For Fast, Accurate Detection
Protects home or property from water damage
Monitors areas with potential for water leaks
Alarm is triggered when water leak or flooding is detected
ProductInfo.Name: Swann SW351-WLA Water Leak Alarm
